column1: Ibitinga is a municipality in the state of São Paulo in Brazil. The population is 57
column2: 649 (2015 est.) in an area of 689 km² (266 mi²). The elevation is 491 m (1
column3: 611 ft). The name comes from the Tupi language
column4: meaning "White Lands". The main rivers near Ibitinga are the Tietê River and its tributaries Jacaré-Pepira River and Jacaré-Guaçu River.

column1: The town is commonly referred to as the "Embroidery National Capital"
column3: which started in the 1960s with immigrants from Madeira Island
column5: when the City Hall promoted the first "Embroidery Fair"
column6: at the City Stadium. Year after year
column7: the town has passed from being dependent on agriculture and cattle to its current situation
column8: where the economy mostly depends on embroidery and tourism.

column1: At the Tietê river in Ibitinga
column2: it is also located a dam (the Ibitinga Hydroelectric Power Station) and one lock. This lock
column3: together with many others at other Tietê dams
column4: allows the navigation of Tietê river along most of its length.
